grading.policies: Late problem sets and projects will not be accepted unless excused in writing by the instructor.

assignments: Assignment 9 (submit by the last day of finals week)

policies.attendance: Full participation in live sessions means showing up on time, being attentive, and participating in any activities or group discussions.
policies.late_work: Late problem sets and projects will not be accepted unless excused in writing by the instructor.
policies.academic_integrity: All Stevens graduate students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.technology_requirements: You will need a computer that can run Python 3.
additional_info.support_resources: For more information about course access or support, contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

_metadata.course_description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is an interdisciplinary field that draws on insights from computer science, engineering, mathematics, statistics, linguistics, psychology, and neuroscience to design agents that can perceive the environment and act upon it.
learning_outcomes: Manage the performance of an AI system and monitor its ongoing effectiveness
Distinguish between hype and rapid advances in AI methods
Assess AI systems along dimensions of fairness, accountability, transparency, ethics, and the law
Plan the lifecycle of an AI project, from discovery through post-deployment monitoring
Develop strategy for deployment of AI solutions within an organization
prerequisites: One advanced ML course (e.g., BIA 667 Deep Learning)
